title: 2 million air fryers recalled due to fire and burn hazards
description: Models of the Cosori Air Fryer were recalled Thursday, according to a release from the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission.

title: About 116 Americans died from gun violence per day this year: Gun Violence Archive
description: Gun violence in the U.S. has taken an average of roughly 116 lives each day in 2023, according to data from Gun Violence Archive.

title: Prison inmate sexual harassment of female officers 'widespread,' watchdog finds
description: Prison inmate sexual harassment of female officers is "widespread," a government watchdog has found.

title: UN approves resolution calling for Russia to leave Ukraine
description: The U.N. General Assembly has passed a nonbinding resolution that calls for Russia to end hostilities and withdraw from its neighbor on the eve of the first anniversary of Moscow’s invasion

title: Prosecutors to seek death penalty against FedEx driver accused of child's murder
description: Prosecutors will seek the death penalty against a FedEx driver accused of abducting and killing 7-year-old Athena Strand if he is convicted of capital murder.

title: European Commission bans TikTok from employees' phones
description: European Commission employees will have to remove the TikTok app from their phones for security reasons, the European Union's executive body said Thursday.

title: Florida students walk out to protest DeSantis race education policies
description: Florida students are walked out in protest of Gov. Ron DeSantis' race education policies.

title: Alligator pulled from NYC lake had swallowed bathtub stopper
description: Authorities say the alligator that was rescued from a chilly lake in New York City over the weekend had swallowed a bathtub stopper

title: Alec Baldwin pleads not guilty, waives 1st court appearance for 'Rust' charges
description: Alec Baldwin waived what would have been his first court appearance after being charged with involuntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting on the set of "Rust."

title: Federal authorities arrest Ozy Media founder Carlos Watson
description: The founder of the troubled digital start-up Ozy Media has been arrested on fraud charges as part of a scheme to prop up the financially struggling company

title: Charges dropped against detainee beaten inside Georgia jail
description: Prosecutors have dropped charges of assault, obstruction and other counts against a Georgia jail detainee after security camera video showed him being beaten by deputies

title: WATCH:  2 cats rescued from building set for demolition in Turkey
description: The demolition of a severely earthquake-damaged building in Turkey turned into a rescue operation when two cats were spotted inside. Both cats were reunited with their owners.

title: 2nd state's governor calls for review of AP African American studies course
description: Virginia will review College Board's AP African American studies course amid nationwide debate following Florida's rejection of the course.

title: Former Wisconsin Gov. Tony Earl has died at age 86
description: Former Wisconsin Governor Tony Earl, who couldn’t overcome a sour economy and was turned out by voters after a single term in the 1980s, has died

title: Record-high drug overdose deaths in this state
description: New data from the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services shows more than 4,000 people -- a record high -- died from drug overdoses in 2021.

title: Attorneys allege Kenosha shooter Rittenhouse evading them
description: Attorneys for a man shot and injured by Kyle Rittenhouse during a protest in 2020 are asking a federal judge to give them more time to serve Rittenhouse with a civil lawsuit, alleging that he is purposefully trying to evade them

title: Alex Murdaugh takes stand in double murder trial
description: Alex Murdaugh, a disgraced South Carolina attorney accused of killing his wife and youngest son, has begun testifying in his own defense in his double murder trial.

title: Investigation begins into Arkansas plane crash that killed 5
description: Federal investigators are heading to Arkansas Thursday to determine the cause of a small plane crash that killed five employees of an environmental consulting firm

title: Harvey Weinstein set to be sentenced for rape conviction in LA
description: Disgraced Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein is scheduled to be sentenced Thursday for rape in his Los Angeles sexual assault trial.

title: Man to be executed for 1990 Florida murder while a fugitive
description: A man convicted of fatally stabbing a woman near Florida's Capitol 32 years ago is set to be executed by lethal injection

title: Internal chaos plagues Bannon-fronted $FJB cryptocurrency, critics say
description: A year after Trump allies Steve Bannon and Boris Epshteyn took over the $FJB cryptocurrency project, some MAGA buyers say the pair has misled them with false promises.

title: R. Kelly to be sentenced for child pornography, enticement of minors for sex
description: R. Kelly will be sentenced by a judge for child pornography and enticement of minors for sex charges in a Chicago federal court.

title: US ending extra help for groceries that started during COVID
description: Nearly 30 million Americans who got extra government help with grocery bills during the pandemic will soon see that aid shrink

title: 1st baby pangolin in Europe born in Prague zoo, doing well
description: A Chinese pangolin has been born in the Prague zoo, the first birth of the critically endangered animal in Europe

title: US nominates Ajay Banga for World Bank president
description: The United States is nominating former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga to lead the World Bank

title: NTSB releases preliminary report into East Palestine train derailment
description: U.S. investigators released a preliminary report into the derailment of a Norfolk Southern train carrying toxic chemicals in East Palestine, Ohio.

title: German court convicts man over deadly 2014 attack in Syria
description: A German court has convicted a Palestinian man from Syria of a war crime and murder for launching a grenade into a crowd of civilians waiting for food in Damascus in 2014

title: US revises down last quarter's economic growth to 2.7% rate
description: The U.S. economy expanded at a 2.7% annual rate from October through December, a solid showing despite rising interest rates and elevated inflation, the government said in a downgrade from its initial estimate

title: Pregnant Russians flock to Argentina seeking new passports
description: Over the past year, Argentine immigration authorities have noticed flights packed with dozens of pregnant Russians

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried faces 4 new charges
description: Disgraced FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried of conspiracy contained in a superseding indictment unsealed Thursday.

title: Six weeks of falling applications for unemployment benefits
description: The number of Americans filing for jobless aid fell last week as the labor market remains resilient in the face of the Federal Reserve’s interest rate increases meant to cool the economy

title: Mental evaluation ordered for man tied to Lyft driver death
description: A judge has ordered a mental evaluation at the request of the attorney for a man who was arrested in North Carolina while driving the car of a dead South Florida Lyft driver

title: Power outages inch toward 1 million as 25 states face monster winter storm
description: Power outages are inching toward 1 million as 25 states from California to Connecticut are on alert for blizzard conditions, heavy snow, strong winds and ice.

title: East Palestine residents confront officials, Norfolk Southern amid new cleanup plan
description: "I don't feel safe in this town," said one resident, Jim Stewart. "You took it away from me. You took this away from us."

title: Women die every 2 minutes during childbirth, pregnancy: Report
description: A new report stares that maternal mortality rates in the U.S. has increased over the past 20 years.

title: IRA dissidents suspected of shooting N Ireland detective
description: A senior Northern Ireland police officer is in critical but stable condition in a hospital after being shot by two masked men while he coached children’s soccer
